title: DIY paintcan pyrolysis kiln for making biochar during dry distillation.

tasks.task: Construct a simple pyrolysis kiln for producing biochar, oil, or other materials
subtasks: Gather necessary components from local stores (hardware, sporting goods)
Acquire a turkey fryer with a variable flame regulator
Prepare a one-gallon reaction vessel (e.g., paint can) with a lid
Reinforce the lid with a bulkhead fitting and copper condenser
Insulate the five-gallon paint bucket and add a heat-resistant steel spreader at the bottom
Assemble the kiln by placing the reaction vessel over the burner, ensuring even heat distribution
Load the vessel with materials (e.g., plastic, bone, wood) and secure the lid for airtight operation
Direct condensate to a collection pan below for recovery of oils or liquids
